name: Sitting Calf Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a bench or step with your legs hanging off the side, forming a 90-degree angle between your thighs and calf muscles.
2. Slowly raise up onto your tiptoes, maintaining control throughout the movement, engaging your calf muscles to support the weight transfer from heel to toe.
3. Hold for a brief moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your calf muscles.
4. Gradually lower back down to the starting position, taking care not to let your heels drop too far, or you may lose control of the movement.
5. Repeat for desired repetitions.
short_summary: Sitting calf raises work the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles of the calf region.
equipment_used: Optional: calf raise machine or platform with footrests
alternative_names: Calf raises on edge of bench
